subject: Data
title: The Census: Counting Every Person
description: One-minute skill: The Census: Counting Every Person.

hook.text: The US Constitution mandates a census every 10 years. The 1890 census nearly broke the government.

buildup.text: Counting 62 million people by hand took almost the full decade. The 1880 census wasn't done before 1890 started.

discovery.text: Herman Hollerith invented an electric tabulating machine using punch cards to count the 1890 census in months.

twist.text: Hollerith's company later merged with others to form IBM â€” born from the need to count people.

climax.text: Census data determines congressional seats, federal funding, and school locations for every American.

punchline.text: Counting people is so important it created IBM.

quiz.question: What innovation solved the 1890 census processing problem?
